creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Audrey Seo and Stephen Addiss
description: gnarled, twisting greyish tree trunk at L; mass of foliage growing out of a knot in center of trunk with wispy green leaves and puffy, red and white blossoms; gnarled branches with wrinkled, young green leaves and vibrant pink and white blossoms interspersed with forming fruits; large, swirling mass of light pink clouds at top; grey rocks and foliage at bottom center
inscription:
嘉永壬子大呂写
椿山弼
markings: ULC (on reverse), square relief; R edge, circle and square
medium: Ink and color on sketch paper
title: Copy of Chinzan’s "Peach Blossoms"
